title: New Visual Exporters & Release v6.1.0

tasks.description: Create src/export/visual/mathematics.ts - Equation derivation trees with proof steps, LaTeX equations in labels, proof structure visualization
Create src/export/visual/physics.ts - Tensor diagrams with rank/components, conservation law flows, physical interpretation visualization
Create src/export/visual/hybrid.ts - Multi-mode orchestration diagrams showing active modes, mode transitions, synthesis points
Create src/export/visual/metareasoning.ts - Strategy evaluation flowcharts with current strategy, alternatives, quality metrics, recommendations
Create src/export/visual/recursive.ts - Recursion trees with base cases, recursive calls, depth visualization, stack trace representation
Create src/export/visual/modal.ts - Possible worlds diagrams with accessibility relations, modal operators, truth value propagation
Update src/services/ExportService.ts - Add 4 integration blocks for Mathematics, Physics, Hybrid, Metareasoning modes
Update src/export/visual/index.ts - Add 4 wrapper methods and re-exports for new visual exporters
Create integration tests for all 6 new modes - one test file per mode verifying Mermaid, DOT, ASCII export
Create comprehensive all-modes visual test - verify all 21 modes can export to all 3 formats
Run full test suite 5 times - verify all 790+ tests pass consistently
Create docs/VISUAL_EXPORTS.md - Comprehensive visual export guide with examples for all 21 modes
Update README.md - Add visual export coverage documentation and examples
Update CHANGELOG.md - Add v6.1.0 entry with visual export features, new exporters, integration changes
Run typecheck - verify no TypeScript errors
Run npm run build - verify dist/ output is clean
Update package.json version to 6.1.0
Commit changes and tag v6.1.0 release
Publish to npm - npm publish
Update memory-mcp with v6.1.0 completion and visual export coverage details

successCriteria: All 6 new visual export modules created and functional
All 6 new modes integrated with ExportService
Zero breaking changes to existing functionality
notes: This sprint creates 6 new visual export modules from scratch following the pattern in existing exporters (e.g., causal.ts, temporal.ts). Each exporter must support Mermaid, DOT, and ASCII formats. The meta-reasoning exporter should visualize strategy evaluations and mode switching recommendations. Focus on clarity and usefulness of diagrams.
